Why It Matters: Correctly identifying whether the query is informational, commercial, transactional, or local, so the page can be aligned to what users expect.
How To Check: Review sample queries from GSC; inspect SERP for content types and CTAs; label each target keyword by intent.
How To Improve: Re-map each target keyword to an intent; ensure page types and templates match the dominant intent per SERP.

Why It Matters: Ensuring the format (blog post, category, product page, tool, comparison) matches what Google is ranking for the query.
How To Check: Manually review top 10 results for each target keyword and categorise them by page type.
How To Improve:
If SERP is mostly product pages, build/optimise a product page instead of a blog; if mostly guides, create an in-depth guide. 

However, if there is an even mix of formats, focus on uniqueness.

Why It Matters: Ensuring the main topic is explained clearly and completely, addressing the core question or problem.
How To Check: Compare your coverage of the main topic to the top 3–5 ranking pages; check if key concepts are missing.
How To Improve: Rewrite or expand main sections to define the topic, give context, and provide clear answers or solutions.

Why It Matters: Showing who wrote the content and why they are qualified increases trust and can improve performance for sensitive topics.
How To Check: Check if key pages have author bylines, bios, and links to author profile pages.
How To Improve: Add detailed author bios, qualifications, and relevant experience; link to LinkedIn or professional profiles where appropriate.

Why It Matters: Demonstrating real-world use (photos, screenshots, experiments, case studies) aligns with Google’s emphasis on 'experience'.
How To Check: Audit content for unique images, screenshots, original data and case studies vs stock or generic content.
How To Improve: Add your own photos, test results, walkthroughs and client stories that show actual hands-on experience.

Why It Matters: Clear, easy-to-read content keeps users engaged and reduces confusion, improving engagement signals.
How To Check: Use readability tools; review average time on page and scroll depth; perform manual skim tests.
How To Improve: Shorten sentences, use headings and bullets, simplify wording; add summaries and key takeaways.

Why It Matters: Content that merely rephrases other pages adds little value; original insights drive links and rankings.
How To Check: Compare your content to top-ranking pages; look for unique points, data, frameworks or visuals.
How To Improve: Add proprietary data, unique frameworks, expert commentary, local examples or tools that competitors lack.

Why It Matters: Links from reputable, topic-aligned sites carry far more weight than links from weak or unrelated sites.
How To Check: Segment referring domains by authority and topical relevance using backlink tools.
How To Improve: Target niche publications, partners and industry resources rather than generic or irrelevant sites.

Factor: Deep Link Quantity to Target URL
Why It Matters: Number of external links pointing directly at the ranking page strongly influences that page’s authority.
How To Check: Use backlink tools to list backlinks to specific URLs; compare vs competitors’ ranking URLs.
How To Improve: Promote key pages via outreach, PR and content marketing to earn more deep links to those URLs.

Factor: Accidental Noindex and Robot txt blocking
Why It Matters: Important pages accidentally set to noindex or blocked in robots will never rank.
How To Check:
Use crawlers and GSC URL Inspection to detect noindex tags, disallow rules and blocked resources.
Use SEO crawler (e.g., Screaming Frog, Sitebulb, etc.) to identify URLs that are blocked by robots.txt.
How To Improve: Remove unintended noindex directives and adjust robots.txt rules for important sections.

Why It Matters: Pointing canonical tags away from the intended ranking URL can cause Google to ignore it.
How To Check: Check canonical tags on target URLs; review GSC 'duplicate, Google chose different canonical' reports.
How To Improve: Set self-referencing canonicals on primary URLs; remove conflicting or duplicate canonicals.

Why It Matters: Matching calls-to-action (download, enquire, buy, read more) to the user's stage in the buying journey to reduce pogo-sticking.
How To Check: Compare CTAs on ranking pages vs competitors; review user paths and bounce rates from key landing pages.
How To Improve: Use softer CTAs (guides, calculators) for top-of-funnel and stronger CTAs (enquiry, quote) for bottom-of-funnel queries.

Why It Matters: Covering related subtopics, FAQs and edge cases that users commonly ask around the main topic.
How To Check: Mine People Also Ask, related searches and site search logs; map missing subtopics against competitors.
How To Improve: Add FAQ sections, subheadings and supporting content to answer common follow-up questions comprehensively.

Why It Matters: Trust is reinforced by secure site, clear contact details, policies, and third-party trust signals.
How To Check: Check for HTTPS, contact page, physical address, privacy/terms pages, social proof and third-party trust badges.
How To Improve: Ensure clear contact options, legal pages, and visible testimonials/awards; keep brand information consistent across web.

Why It Matters: Linking to and referencing reputable sources signals research quality and helps establish authority.
How To Check: Review outbound links and cited sources on key pages; assess their authority and relevance.
How To Improve: Reference official documents, studies and recognised authorities; avoid linking to low-quality or spammy sources.

Why It Matters: Content should help users achieve something: make a decision, complete a task, or understand a concept.
How To Check: Review content against user journeys; check event tracking for downloads, clicks and interactions.
How To Improve: Include step-by-step instructions, checklists, templates, calculators, and clear next-step guidance.

Why It Matters: Using the main keyword naturally in title, H1, intro and URL helps search engines understand the page topic.
How To Check: Scan title, H1, first paragraph, URL and key headings for presence of the main keyword.
How To Improve: Adjust title and headings to include the primary keyword in a natural, user-friendly way.

Why It Matters: Including related phrases helps cover user phrasing variations and strengthens topical relevance.
How To Check: Use keyword tools and PAA to list variants; check if they appear in headings and body content.
How To Improve: Integrate related phrases into subheadings, FAQs and examples without keyword stuffing.

Why It Matters: The title must reflect both the keyword and the core benefit to entice clicks and set correct expectations.
How To Check: Compare title tags to actual on-page content and to competitor titles in the SERP.
How To Improve: Rewrite titles to highlight benefit, primary keyword and differentiator (e.g. location, USP).

Why It Matters: Number of unique domains linking to the site; more diverse, quality domains typically indicate stronger authority.
How To Check: Use backlink tools to count referring domains and compare with competitors.
How To Improve: Pursue campaigns that earn links from new, relevant sites rather than repeating the same sources.

Why It Matters: Growing branded search signals stronger brand recognition and often correlates with higher trust and resilience.
How To Check: Monitor branded queries in GSC and trend data in keyword tools.
How To Improve: Run brand campaigns (PR, offline ads, social) that drive users to search your brand name directly.

Why It Matters: Anchors that describe the target topic help relevance; over-optimised anchors can trigger spam signals.
How To Check: Analyse anchors for each key URL; look for overuse of exact-match phrases.
How To Improve: Encourage varied, natural anchors in outreach (brand + topic, partial match, descriptive phrases).

Why It Matters: Central hub pages that organise a topic help search engines understand your topical coverage.
How To Check: Identify if there are overview pages that link to all major subtopics for a theme.
How To Improve: Create hub pages (e.g. 'Complete Guide to X') that summarise and link to related detailed articles.

Why It Matters: Covering all key subtopics shows breadth and depth on a subject area.
How To Check: Map all articles to topic clusters; compare coverage vs leading competitors.
How To Improve: Plan and publish missing subtopic articles; connect them back to the hub and between each other.

Why It Matters: Large numbers of obviously manipulative or toxic links can trigger algorithmic demotions or manual penalties.
How To Check: Use backlink tools to identify low-quality domains, link networks and irrelevant foreign-language sites.
How To Improve: Stop spammy link building; disavow clearly toxic domains if necessary; focus on white-hat link acquisition.

Why It Matters: This ratio measures the balance between how many outbound links your site is sending to other sites versus how many inbound links (backlinks) you are receiving. An ideal balance is crucial for maintaining a healthy link profile and avoiding any appearance of "link farming." Ideally, the number should be <40%
How To Check: Go to the "Backlink Profile" section to see the number of incoming (backlinks) and outgoing (referring) links. You can compare these numbers to calculate the ratio.
How To Improve: While a balanced ratio is important, it’s equally important to focus on the quality of the sites you are linking to. A few high-quality, relevant outgoing links can enhance your page’s relevance and authority.

Why It Matters: Backlinks from a variety of sources (websites hosted on different IPs) are generally considered more valuable than multiple links from the same IP. Having backlinks from multiple unique IPs signals to search engines that your site is being recognized by a broad range of reputable sources, which can improve your domain authority.
How To Check: Ahrefs: In the "Backlink Profile" section, Ahrefs shows a list of domains and the IP addresses associated with them. You can check how many unique IPs are linking to your site.
How To Improve: Focus on gaining backlinks from websites hosted on different networks and servers. This could involve outreach to a variety of websites in your industry, guest posting, media mentions, etc.

Why It Matters: If entire sections (e.g. categories, locations) are poorly indexed, you lose large ranking potential.
How To Check: Group pages by template or directory; compare crawled vs indexed counts.
How To Improve: Improve internal linking and sitemaps for under-indexed sections; fix technical issues affecting those templates.

Why It Matters: Measures how quickly the main content loads; slow LCP hurts both rankings and UX.
How To Check: Check LCP in PageSpeed Insights and CWV reports (field data).
How To Improve: Optimise hero images, critical CSS and server response times; use caching and CDNs.

Why It Matters: Measures responsiveness to user input; poor INP leads to sluggish UX and can impact rankings.
How To Check: Use INP metrics in CWV and field data reports to identify pages with poor interaction latency, then reduce heavy JavaScript, defer non-critical scripts, and optimise main thread work to improve Site Speed & Core Web Vitals
How To Improve: Optimise JavaScript rendering by reducing heavy scripts, deferring non-critical resources, implementing lazy loading for below-the-fold content, and minimising main thread work

Why It Matters: Improper viewport or layout can make content unreadable or difficult to use on mobile devices.
How To Check: Run mobile-friendly tests; manually inspect layout on common screen sizes.
How To Improve: Set correct viewport meta tag; use responsive grids and avoid fixed-width elements.

Why It Matters: Pages buried too deep are crawled less often and considered less important.
How To Check: Crawl site; measure click distance from homepage to important URLs.
How To Improve: Reduce depth by linking key pages from nav, hubs, and high-authority pages.

Why It Matters: Pages with few or no internal links are hard to discover and rarely rank.
How To Check: Compare crawl data with XML sitemaps and analytics; identify URLs with zero or few inlinks.
How To Improve: Add contextual internal links from relevant pages; include priority pages in navigation where appropriate.

Why It Matters: Uncontrolled parameter URLs create duplicates that dilute authority and waste crawl budget.
How To Check: List parameterised URLs from logs or crawls; review canonical tags and robots rules.
How To Improve: Use canonicals, noindex, or parameter rules to restrict indexing of low-value filtered/sorted variants.

Why It Matters: CTR should be compared to typical CTR at that position; Low CTR may indicate snippet issues, misalignment with search intent, or strong competition
How To Check: Extract CTR and average position from GSC; compare with benchmarks per position band.
How To Improve: Improve titles and metas; consider rich result optimisation and better angle for the topic. Optimize snippet copy to match search intent.

Why It Matters: Poor layout or burying key information reduces engagement and task completion.
How To Check: Use scroll tracking and heatmaps to see how far users scroll on key pages.
How To Improve: Move critical information higher; add visual breaks and compelling subheadings to pull users down the page.

Why It Matters: Clicks on key elements (tabs, accordions, CTAs) indicate active engagement beyond mere scrolling.
How To Check: Instrument events in analytics; monitor interaction rates on key elements.
How To Improve: Make CTAs prominent; ensure interactive elements are intuitive and add clear value.

Why It Matters: Featured snippets or AI modules can capture clicks even if traditional rankings remain.
How To Check: Inspect SERPs to see if queries trigger snippets/AI; check if competitors occupy those spots.
How To Improve: Structure content with concise definitions, lists and tables; use schema and clear headings to target snippets.

Why It Matters: Local packs, shopping carousels or other verticals can dominate above-the-fold space.
How To Check: Check SERPs for the presence and position of local/shopping packs for target queries.
How To Improve: Optimise GBP and product feeds; consider local SEO or shopping optimisation alongside organic pages.

Why It Matters: Competitors adding new sections, FAQs or media can increase their relative value and outrank you.
How To Check: Use change monitoring tools; manually compare old vs new versions for key competitor pages.
How To Improve: Regularly benchmark your pages; match or exceed competitors’ depth and usefulness.

Why It Matters: Updates focused on helpful content can heavily affect sites with shallow or SEO-first content.
How To Check: Compare traffic and rankings before/after update dates; identify sections most affected.
How To Improve: Audit content for genuine usefulness; remove or improve thin, repetitive or unhelpful pages.

Why It Matters: Sites with manipulative link profiles can see sudden drops during spam updates.
How To Check: Look for traffic drops aligning with link-related updates; review backlink profile for risky patterns.
How To Improve: Clean up spammy link tactics; disavow clearly toxic links; shift to quality-first link building.

Why It Matters: Fully completed profiles and correct primary/secondary categories improve local pack relevance.
How To Check: Review GBP fields, categories and attributes in the dashboard.
How To Improve: Fill all fields, choose precise categories, and keep business info up to date.

Why It Matters: Higher ratings and sufficient volume drive both rankings and user trust.
How To Check: Monitor rating and review count on Google and key platforms.
How To Improve: Implement ethical review generation flows and post-visit prompts; maintain excellent service.

Why It Matters: Topics such as pricing, regulations or technology require frequent updates to stay competitive.
How To Check: Check publication and last-updated dates for key pages vs competitors.
How To Improve: Schedule refreshes for time-sensitive pages and incorporate the latest information and examples.

Why It Matters: Clearly labelled questions and answers make content easier for LLMs and users to consume.
How To Check: Review key pages for explicit questions (as headings) and concise answer blocks.
How To Improve: Add FAQ sections and use headings that reflect common user questions.

Why It Matters: How-to tasks broken into numbered steps are easy to reuse in LLM responses and help users complete tasks.
How To Check: Review guides and tutorials for presence of ordered steps and clear sequencing.
How To Improve: Refactor instructions into numbered steps with clear start and end points.

Factor: Robots & Meta Controls for AI Crawlers
Why It Matters: Specific directives may allow or restrict AI model access to your content.
How To Check: Inspect robots.txt and meta tags for any AI/ML-specific rules; review server logs for AI user agents.
How To Improve: Set consistent policy across the site for AI access based on business goals; avoid accidental blocking of important sections.

Why It Matters: Centralising core facts reduces contradictions across pages and external profiles.
How To Check: Check if there is a single, authoritative page with key facts (founded date, HQ, services, etc.).
How To Improve: Create and maintain an About/FAQ page that lists agreed canonical facts; reference it in schema.

Why It Matters: Misaligned info across the web makes it harder for LLMs and users to know what is correct.
How To Check: Audit website, GBP, social profiles and key directories for discrepancies in core facts.
How To Improve: Update inconsistent listings and profiles to match canonical facts.

Why It Matters: Priority pages need sufficient internal links to signal importance and drive authority.
How To Check: Use crawl data to count internal inlinks for each target page.
How To Improve: Add links from high-authority pages (homepage, hubs) to priority URLs using descriptive anchors.

Why It Matters: Mentioning key entities (brands, tools, locations, standards) and domain-specific terms helps search engines understand depth and relevance.
How To Check: Extract entities from top-ranking pages; compare with your content using NLP/entity extraction tools.
How To Improve: Add relevant entities and define important jargon clearly; avoid meaningless keyword stuffing.

Why It Matters: Descriptive internal anchors signal page topics and help distribute relevance internally.
How To Check: Export internal links to target pages; review anchor phrases for relevance and variation.
How To Improve: Replace generic anchors ('click here') with descriptive topics ('SEO audit services in Singapore').

Why It Matters: A strong description can significantly improve CTR even if it is not a direct ranking signal.
How To Check: Review CTR vs impressions in GSC; compare your snippet to competing snippets for the same query.
How To Improve: Craft descriptions with clear value, proof and a CTA; mention key features, offers or outcomes.

Why It Matters: Promising something in the snippet and not delivering increases bounces and reduces trust.
How To Check: Check if users quickly exit after landing; confirm snippet promises match content sections.
How To Improve: Ensure hero text and above-the-fold content deliver on what the snippet promises.

Why It Matters: In-content editorial links tend to be more valuable than sidebar or footer links.
How To Check: Inspect a sample of linking pages to see where links are placed and in what context.
How To Improve: Prioritise editorial placements within the main content body when doing outreach.

Why It Matters: Links between cluster pages pass authority and clarify topical relationships.
How To Check: Crawl and filter links between pages in the same topic cluster.
How To Improve: Add contextual internal links between related articles within the same cluster.

Why It Matters: More people talking about the brand across the web usually indicates greater prominence and trust.
How To Check: Use brand monitoring tools to count mentions across web and social over time.
How To Improve: Increase PR activity, partnerships, sponsorships and community engagement that naturally trigger brand mentions.

Why It Matters: Positive, contextually relevant mentions support trust; negative coverage or spammy mentions can hurt brand perception.
How To Check: Analyse sentiment of brand mentions; review context of high-visibility mentions manually.
How To Improve: Address negative feedback, improve service, and encourage positive coverage from happy customers.

Why It Matters: Unnatural spikes or highly patterned anchors/placements can look manipulative.
How To Check: Chart new links over time; examine anchor distribution and link types.
How To Improve: Aim for steady, organic link growth from varied sources; avoid large-scale, identical placements.

Why It Matters: Layout shifts during load frustrate users and are a core Web Vital.
How To Check: Review CLS in field data reports and lab tools; watch recordings of page load.
How To Improve: Set explicit width/height for images and iframes; avoid inserting content above existing content after load.

Why It Matters: Small text or closely packed buttons cause usability problems and can trigger mobile issues.
How To Check: Use mobile usability reports; manually test navigation and forms on mobile.
How To Improve: Increase font sizes, button sizes and spacing; avoid tiny links especially in nav and forms.

Why It Matters: Similar content on different URLs can confuse search engines about which page to rank.
How To Check: Use crawl tools to find duplicate titles, descriptions, and content similarity.
How To Improve: Merge or consolidate similar pages; set canonical to a single, strong version.

Why It Matters: All pages should use HTTPS; mixed usage can signal poor security practices.
How To Check: Check if HTTP URLs redirect to HTTPS; scan site for any non-HTTPS live URLs.
How To Improve: Force HTTPS with 301 redirects globally; update internal links and canonical tags to HTTPS versions.

Why It Matters: Broken schema prevents rich results and can confuse search engines about content type.
How To Check: Run Rich Results Test and monitor GSC enhancements reports for errors/warnings.
How To Improve: Fix invalid properties, missing required fields and syntax issues in JSON-LD.

Why It Matters: Using schema that matches your content type (Product, Article, LocalBusiness, FAQ) enhances understanding and eligibility for features.
How To Check: Audit key templates for the presence of appropriate schema types.
How To Improve: Implement and maintain schema for all major content types and keep it updated when content changes.

Why It Matters: If users must hunt for the answer, they are more likely to bounce back to SERP. potentially impact rankings
How To Check: Review page structure; watch recordings; check how quickly the core answer appears above the fold. Use GA4 to monitor scroll depth, average engagement time per page, and engaged sessions.
How To Improve: Summarise key answer or recommendation near the top; support with more detail below.

Why It Matters: Aggressive popups and ads can cause immediate exits and poorer UX signals.
How To Check: Audit pages on mobile and desktop for interstitials; review user feedback and recordings.
How To Improve: Tone down or delay popups; reduce clutter; ensure content is accessible before any prompts.

Why It Matters: Better UX can improve engagement, CTR and conversions, indirectly influencing rankings.
How To Check: Review competitor layouts and UX changes over time; observe their engagement signals where estimable.
How To Improve: Update your templates with clearer layouts, improved visuals and mobile-first design.

Why It Matters: Many industries have seasonal demand; traffic can drop even when rankings hold or improve.
How To Check: Compare impressions and clicks year-on-year for key periods; use seasonal trend data.
How To Improve: Create seasonal campaigns and content; align budgets and expectations with seasonal curves.

Why It Matters: User interest may shift to alternative solutions or terms; older queries decline.
How To Check: Check emerging keywords and declining terms in GSC and keyword tools.
How To Improve: Expand content to cover new, adjacent topics and update messaging to reflect changing user preferences.

Why It Matters: Fresh photos and posts signal an active, engaging business and can influence user choice.
How To Check: Check photo count, recency, and presence of Posts in GBP.
How To Improve: Upload high-quality interior/exterior and product photos; post offers and updates regularly.

Why It Matters: Recent reviews and owner responses show an active, customer-focused business.
How To Check: Check how recent the last 10–20 reviews are and whether responses are prompt.
How To Improve: Respond quickly and professionally to all reviews; encourage ongoing feedback from new customers.

Why It Matters: Schema about your organisation, people and products helps systems connect your entities.
How To Check: Validate Organization, Person and Product schema on relevant pages.
How To Improve: Implement detailed entity schema with sameAs links to key profiles and directories.

Why It Matters: Profiles on trusted sites (Wikipedia, major directories, industry associations) help establish your entity in the graph.
How To Check: Search brand and key people to see if such profiles appear; review consistency of information.
How To Improve: Create and maintain profiles on authoritative sites where possible; ensure consistent naming and facts.

Why It Matters: Consistent Name, Address and Phone across your website, GBP and major directories helps Google confirm that multiple references point to the same real-world business, which supports both local rankings and trust.
How To Check: Compare NAP on site, GBP and key directories. Use a citation audit tool or manual spot checks for mismatches in name, address format, phone, and URL.
How To Improve: Standardise an official NAP format. Update major directories and citations to match. Fix duplicate or outdated listings.

Factor: Local Relevance of Primary Location Page
Why It Matters: A strong location page that clearly targets the city or area, answers local user intent and is internally linked from GBP and navigation gives Google a clear “entity home” for the local business.
How To Check: Review the page GBP links to. Check that it has unique local content, the full NAP, embedded map, local FAQs, and mentions of neighbourhoods or service areas.
How To Improve: Build or enhance a dedicated location or “contact” page with unique local copy, NAP, map, local testimonials and clear calls to action. Link GBP to this page.

Why It Matters: Visible dates in snippets affect click behaviour and perceived relevance.
How To Check: Inspect snippets for date stamps, both for your site and competitors.
How To Improve: Ensure pages update meaningfully so Google can show fresh dates; avoid fake date changes.

Why It Matters: Removing or merging stale, low-performing content can improve overall quality signals.
How To Check: Identify pages with long-term low traffic and weak engagement; check for overlap with other URLs.
How To Improve: Rewrite, merge or deindex underperforming content that doesn’t fit strategy.

Why It Matters: Hard paywalls limit content visibility to crawlers and LLMs; soft paywalls may allow partial use.
How To Check: Review key content journeys; test access from clean browsers without login.
How To Improve: Decide which content should be open vs gated; consider teaser sections with public summaries.

Why It Matters: Comprehensive documentation and FAQs on key topics increase the chance that LLMs rely on your site.
How To Check: Map all informational pages to a matrix of key topics and questions.
How To Improve: Fill gaps with new articles, FAQs and glossaries; link them in a logical knowledge hub.

Why It Matters: Varied but relevant anchors strengthen topical signals while avoiding spam patterns.
How To Check: Export internal anchors for key URLs; check for over-reliance on one phrase.
How To Improve: Use a mix of exact, partial and descriptive anchors reflecting user language.

Factor: Menu & Footer Exposure of Key Sections
Why It Matters: Pages linked from global navigation elements are treated as more important and are more discoverable.
How To Check: Review menus and footers; cross-check which sections are accessible from every page.
How To Improve: Add key category and service pages to nav or footer in a user-friendly way.

Why It Matters: Large volumes of low-engagement pages can drag down overall site quality signals.
How To Check: Identify URLs with minimal traffic and poor engagement over 6–12 months.
How To Improve: Decide per page whether to improve, merge or noindex based on strategic importance.

Why It Matters: Uncontrolled indexing of tag and archive pages creates thin, duplicative content.
How To Check: Crawl for tag, category and search result URLs that are indexed.
How To Improve: Noindex low-value archives and internal search results; focus on optimised landing pages.

Why It Matters: Broken links harm UX and can waste crawl budget if not managed properly.
How To Check: Use crawl tools and GSC coverage reports to identify 404 and 410 responses.
How To Improve: Redirect to the most relevant existing page where appropriate; otherwise serve proper 404/410 with helpful navigation.

Why It Matters: Pages that look like errors or have almost no value but return 200 can be treated as soft 404s by Google.
How To Check: Review GSC soft 404 reports and thin pages with near-zero content or product availability.
How To Improve: Improve content, redirect to better alternatives, or show proper 404/410 responses as appropriate.

Why It Matters: Splits ranking signals and wastes crawl budget.
How To Check: Use Screaming Frog + GSC “Duplicate” reports.
How To Improve: Add canonical tags, consolidate pages, rewrite thin duplicates.

Why It Matters: Creates unlimited duplicate versions of the same page.
How To Check: Check GSC Coverage → inspect URLs with parameters.
How To Improve: Block via robots.txt, add canonical tags, set parameter handling rules.

Why It Matters: Faceted filters create thousands of low-value URLs.
How To Check: Crawl site filters/sorting; check Google index using site:.
How To Improve: Noindex filter pages, canonical to main category, restrict crawl paths.

Why It Matters: Google chooses the preferred URL on its own, causing indexing issues.
How To Check: Screaming Frog → Canonical column.
How To Improve: Add self-referencing canonical tags to each page.

Why It Matters: Gives Google mixed signals, leading to wrong page ranking.
How To Check: Check pages manually; crawl canonical structure.
How To Improve: Use correct self-canonicals; avoid cross-canonicals unless intentional.

Why It Matters: Pagination pages become thin/duplicate content.
How To Check: Search: site:domain.com inurl:/page/.
How To Improve: Add noindex,follow or canonical to main page.

Why It Matters: Creates duplicate versions of your entire site.
How To Check: Search: site:domain.com -https.
How To Improve: Redirect all HTTP → HTTPS; update internal links.

Why It Matters: Slow crawl, wasted signals, weaker indexing.
How To Check: Screaming Frog → Redirect chain report.
How To Improve: Fix chains to single-step redirects (old → new).

Why It Matters: Google gets stuck and wastes crawl budget.
How To Check: Screaming Frog → Loop report.
How To Improve: Fix redirect logic; remove circular redirects.

Why It Matters: Error pages indexed worsen SEO quality.
How To Check: GSC Coverage Report; Screaming Frog status codes.
How To Improve: Fix broken pages or properly return 404/410 + remove from index.

Why It Matters: Means Google can’t see the noindex tag or robots rules conflict.
How To Check: Inspect pages in GSC; check meta tags.
How To Improve: Ensure meta noindex is visible; avoid blocking via robots.txt; fix implementation.

Why It Matters: Helps search engines understand what an image is about, improving image search visibility, accessibility, and overall page relevance for target keywords
How To Check: Use an SEO crawler (e.g. Screaming Frog, Ahrefs Site Audit) to scan your site and pull a report of all images and their alt text. Then filter for images with missing, empty, or overly long alt text and prioritise fixes on key templates and high-traffic pages.
How To Improve: Improve image alt text by writing short, clear, keyword-relevant descriptions that accurately explain the image’s content and purpose, while using empty alt attributes for purely decorative images.

Why It Matters: Loading insecure resources on secure pages can trigger browser warnings and reduce trust.
How To Check: Use browser dev tools and crawlers to identify HTTP resources on HTTPS pages.
How To Improve: Serve all assets over HTTPS; update hard-coded asset URLs or use protocol-relative URLs.

Why It Matters: CTR patterns differ by device and market; problems may be localised.
How To Check: Segment CTR by device and country in GSC.
How To Improve: Customise messaging, language and localisation for key regions; ensure mobile snippets are compelling.

Why It Matters: Complicated forms reduce enquiry and lead volume from organic traffic.
How To Check: Review form abandonment rates and field completion drop-offs.
How To Improve: Reduce the number of mandatory fields; streamline steps; add trust badges around forms.

Why It Matters: If the offer doesn’t match user expectations from the query, conversions lag even with good traffic.
How To Check: Compare query intent with page offer; review user feedback and survey data.
How To Improve: Align offers (free consult, demo, guide) to the query’s stage; clarify value proposition in hero section.

Why It Matters: Consistent publication expands your footprint and signals an active site.
How To Check: Track number of new indexed pages over time by content type.
How To Improve: Maintain a content calendar with regular publishing aligned to strategy, not just volume.

Why It Matters: Defining jargon improves comprehension for both users and models.
How To Check: Review content for unexplained acronyms and technical phrases.
How To Improve: Provide short, inline definitions the first time a technical term appears.

Why It Matters: Breadcrumbs reinforce hierarchy and provide additional internal links for crawlers.
How To Check: Check for visible breadcrumbs and BreadcrumbList schema on relevant pages.
How To Improve: Implement breadcrumbs that reflect the site’s logical hierarchy; mark them up with schema.

Why It Matters: Pages with no or very few internal links are hard to discover and rarely rank, regardless of content quality.
How To Check: Compare crawled URLs with analytics or CMS URL lists to find pages with zero or extremely low internal inlinks.
How To Improve: Either integrate these pages into relevant hubs with contextual links or deindex/consolidate them if they provide little value.

Why It Matters: Broken internal links waste crawl budget and hurt UX. Links that pass through long redirect chains dilute link equity and slow crawling.
How To Check: Run a crawl to identify 4xx internal links and links that resolve through multiple redirects.
How To Improve: Update internal links to point directly to the final, canonical URL and fix or remove broken links.
